conclusion: The wire consists of two straight, mutually-perpendicular segments.
Segment ca (length L) carries current I upward.
Segment cd (length 2L) carries current I to the right.
For a straight segment in a uniform magnetic field that is perpendicular to the plane of the wire, the magnitude of the magnetic (Ampère) force is F = I L B sin θ.
θ is the angle between the current direction and the magnetic-field direction.
The field is perpendicular to the plane of the wire, so θ = 90° and sin θ = 1 for both segments.
Force on ca: F₁ = I (L) B = IBL.
Force on cd: F₂ = I (2 L) B = 2 IBL.
The two forces act at right angles to one another.
The resultant magnitude is F = √(F₁² + F₂²).
The magnitude of the total Ampère force on the bent wire is F = I B L √5.
